busi·ness expense.definition: an expense made in furtherance of one's business esp. as part of the cost of operating a business in the taxable year in which the expense is incurred compareandin this entry
busi·ness expense.note: Business expenses are generally tax deductible in the year the expense is incurred.

capital expense.definition: an expense made in a business that will provide a long-term benefit
capital expense.note: Capital expenses are not tax deductible as business expenses but may be used for depreciation or amortization.

mov·ing expense.definition: an expense incurred in changing one's residence that is tax deductible if incurred for business reasons (as when one's job requires relocation)

or·di·nary and nec·es·sary expense.definition: an expense that is normal or customary and helpful and appropriate for the operation of a particular business or trade and that is made during the taxable year called also
or·di·nary and nec·es·sary expense.note: Ordinary and necessary expenses are tax deductible.

per·son·al expense.definition: an expense incurred in the course of one's personal affairs as distinguished from the course of one's employment or the operation of a business comparein this entryvt
per·son·al expense.note: Personal expenses are usually not tax deductible.

2.definition: to write off as an expense
